name: Order of the Radiant Heart

description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40289.name: A Cobblestone Road
description: The cobblestone road travels on, from the Eastern Highway, to the
west, and linking onward toward a glimmering hall in the northeast.
Scattered trees flank the road, providing some welcome shade while
still affording excellent views of the countryside.  {x

description: {8This is a small cramped cell with cold stone walls.  Several

no windows in the cell and no furnishings other than a pile of
dirty straw in one corner.  A faint smell of human waste comes
from a bucket in the far corner.{x

40203.name: Hall of Pennance
description: {8The {YHall {wof {RP{rennance{8, where punishment for past crimes is meted
out.  This room continues the long trek through the Gatehouse, and
marks a continuing battle for attackers to gain entrance to the
Order's Stronghold.  Many an opponent of the Order have been stopped
here and begged for forgiveness.  The dark path continues both before
and behind those who visit this place.  {x

40246.name: Dungeon of the Heart
description: {8The Dungeon of the Heart is typical of most dungeons.  It is a dark
and dank place excavated below the main keep.  The order does not
often house prisoners, and as such, there is only one cell.  There is
only one penalty for significant violations, and that is death.  {cW{ga{ct{ge{cr
{cr{gi{cv{Gul{ce{gt{cs{D run down the walls, pooling here and between the stones of the
floor.  The single cell lies to the south, and a set of slimy stone
stairs leads up.  {x

no windows in the cell and no furnishings other than a pile of

40225.name: South Central Corridor
description: {8The central corridor runs north and south through the center of the
keep.  The corridor forms a basic entryway to the keep with cast iron
coat hooks along the walls for visiting dignitaries and members of the
Order to shed their outer garments.  To the south is an imposing oak
and iron door.  West lie the administrative offices of the Order, and
to the east is a comfy looking lounge with a large fireplace complete
with a crackling fire.  The central corridor continues to the north.  {x

40323.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x

{8ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
{8The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
{8from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
{8navigation difficult.{w{x

40234.name: Torm's Chapel
description: {8Torm's Chapel, dedicated to the God of Good, Healing, Law,
Protection and Strength, this chapel is spartan to say the least.
There is a small stone altar standing against the north wall.  To the
left of the altar is an armor stand with a set of chain mail hanging
upon it, and to the right is a sword rack with a Greatsword standing
tip down.  West is the weaponsmith, and east is the central corridor.
{x

40351.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40245.name: Temple Store
description: {8Run by Tuck, a priest of some note in the region, the Temple
Store of the Order specializes in potions, scrolls, wands, and herbs,
of both healing and harmful natures.  Tuck never shares any of his
recipes, and all work here is custom.  The store has one long counter
near the north wall, with shelves lining the remaining walls.  These
shelves contain various bottles, parchments, wands, and packets of
herbs that aid members of the Order in their daily duties.  {x

40204.name: Inner Gate of the Stronghold of the Order
description: {8The {BInner Gate {8of the {RS{rtronghold{8 is yet another imposing structure.
Unlike the Portcullis at the south end of the Gatehouse, the Inner
gate is a massive oak door.  In times of peace, the twelve foot tall
doors are thrown open, allowing visitors to come and go, but in these
troubled times, they are closed and barred.  The doors are more than
twelve inches thick, and a small postern door provides access to foot
traffic for those who have the key.  {x
The Inner Gate to the Stronghold of the Radiant Heart is a stout
wooden structure.  Standing tall enough to allow a rider and horse
to enter, this gate is usually closed, owing to the troubling times
we live in.  The gate is at least 12 inches thick, constructed of
solid oak.  A small postern door allows limited foot traffic into
the Stronghold.

{8                          Room Three
{8              < Room Five

40219.name: Southern Parapet
description: {cThe battlements between the corner stairs provide excellent shelter
from the view of prying eyes, while allowing individuals to keep a
good lookout on what is going on around them.  Fifty feet above the
courtyard below, these walls are used by guards to make routine rounds
and ensure the integrity of the Stronghold of the Order.  Below is the
inner gate.  A small door leads to the south from here.  {x

40261.name: Guard's Passage
description: {8A small stone passageway, this room is fairly non-descript.  The
walls are unadorned, owing to the utilitarian nature of this hall.
Torch brackets with burnt out torches line the walls.  East is the
entrance to the Upper Gatehouse, and the Guard's Passage continues to
the south.  {x

40210.name: Northern Courtyard
description: {gThe Northern Courtyard is generally reached by a stone path
traveling north south from the main keep.  The path terminates at the
north wall, where there appears to be a stable built into a portion of
the wall.  Grassy swaths flank the stone path, continuing to both the
east and west.  North lies the Stables of the Order, and to the south
lies the main keep.  {x

40224.name: Eastern Courtyard
description: {gThe eastern courtyard is lined with a {Wcobbled path{g running due east
and west.  This path is flanked by green grassy spaces to the north
and south as the courtyard spreads to the corners of the defensive
walls.  To the east is the {YG{yat{Ye {wof {rt{Rh{me {MRi{rsi{Rng {yS{wu{Yn,{g the main entrance
to the Stronghold of the Order.  The courtyard continues to the north,
south, and west.  {x

40214.name: Entrance to the Stronghold of the Radiant Heart
description: {8A large set of stone steps leads down to the courtyard with the
entrance to the Stronghold of the Radiant Heart standing directly to
the north.  The entrance to this imposing stone keep is a set of
double doors constructed of solid oak and iron, making the building a
truly imposing structure.  Carved over the door and gilded in gold
leaf are the words {y"{YThe Courage of One can Change the Destiny of Many{y"{x

{8                           Room One
{8                           Room Two

40230.name: Baths
description: {8The {BB{ba{ct{Ch{Bs {cof {Cthe {BO{br{cd{Ce{Br{8 are fed by {Bdeep {Chot {csprings{8 that are rumored
to have significant healing powers.  The water is pumped in through
pipes sunk deep in the earth, recycling water on a regular basis.
Just the place to soak weary bones, rest and recouperate after a
campaign.  {x

40206.name: Southwestern Courtyard
description: {gThe Southwestern corner of the Courtyard is a grass covered expanse
used by foot soldiers for conducting drills.  A {8set of stone stairs{g
leads up to the parapest above, providing guards easy access to their
posts for doing rounds while on duty.  The courtyard spreads out north
and east from here.  {x

40285.name: A Cobblestone Road
description: The cobblestone road is flanked by a sparse covering of trees to
the north and south.  The road feels open and exposed, but the trees
offer no better cover.  The road continues to the east and the west.

40240.name: Antechamber to the Council of the Radiant Heart
description: {8The antechamber to the Council of the Radiant Heart is merely a
waiting room outside the council chamber.  Cushioned benches line the
circular room, and a {CC{cr{Yy{ys{wt{Ya{cl {CD{co{Ym{ce{8 allows for additional light in the
room.  At night, the stars can be seen through the dome, giving the
room a solemn feel and making those sitting here feel how small they
are in relation to the rest of the world.  A spiral stair leads down
from this room to the second floor of the Keep.  In the north wall is
a door leading to the Council Chambers of the Order of the Radiant
Heart.  Over the door is the inscription:
{w"Let those who enter do so with a clear conscience and a light heart,
for those who enter with anger and hate in their hearts shall find
only the wrath of the order descending upon them."{x

40262.name: Guard's Passage
description: {8A small stone passageway, this room is fairly non-descript.  The
walls are unadorned, owing to the utilitarian nature of this hall.
Torch brackets with burnt out torches line the walls.  The Guard's
Passage continues to the north, and to the west lies the Hell's Maw
Guardroom.  {x

40237.name: North Main Hall
description: {8Similar to the first floor, the second floor has a single main
artery that directs traffic, the Main Hall.  The northern portion of
the main hall transits north and south leading from the Dining Hall to
the Southern Stairs.  Stone walls reach to a height of at least 20
feet, culminating in a Gothic Arch at the peak.  Tapestries adorn the
walls, depicting important events in the Order's history.  Corridors
head east and west from the Main Hall, leading the various rooms of
the Order.  {x

description: {8This is a sand floored room with a domed ceiling help up by large
pillars throughout the chamber.  Weapon racks line the walls offering
a large selection of tools to practice with.  Blood marks some of
the pillars from sparring sessions turned too serious.{x

would be attackers begin to think that maybe attacking the Order's
Stronghold wasn't such a good idea.  Murder holes, arrow slits, and
wall spikes continue through this room with darkness stretching both
ahead and behind.  {x

40260.name: Upper Gatehouse

gatehouse, and allows soldiers of the order quick access to the murder
holds spread throughout this nefarious entrance.  The walls are lined
with all sorts of implements used to deter attackers, and barrels hold
balista bolts and other projectiles for use by defenders of this keep.

spots on the wall are marked by previous prisoners.  There are
no windows in the cell and no furnishings other than a pile of
dirty straw in one corner.  A faint smell of human waste comes
from a bucket in the far corner.{x

40207.name: Southeastern Courtyard
description: {gThe Southeastern corner of the Courtyard is a grass covered
expanse used by mounted soldiers for conducting drills.  A
{8set of stone stairs {gleads up to the parapets above, providing
guards easy access to their posts for doing rounds while on
duty.  The courtyard spreads out north and west from here.

40331.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40293.name: The Storage Room
description: {8This is a relatively large room with a high ceiling.  Shelves
line the walls as well as several rows in the middle of the
room.  The shelves are packed full of vials and pots full of
ingredients.  A smell of drying herbs infuses the air here
from the herbs hung from the cieling.  Friar Tuck's Apprentice
is here taking inventory of the items necessary for the operation
of the shop.{x

40243.name: Artifacts of Faerun
description: {8A magical tingling sensation passes through individuals entering
this room.  The small circular room houses numerous pillars with
different items atop each one.  Beneath each item is a plaque
indicating where the item was found, and what the relevance of the
item is to the Order.  {x

description: {8 Helm's Chapel, dedicated to the God of Law, Planning, Protection,
and Strength, this chapel is somewhat spartan.  There is a small stone
altar standing against the north wall flanked by small bookshelves
housing several basic tomes on laws, and treatises on protection of
the weak.  The set upon the altar are a set of plate armor and bastard
sword.  The Order's practice hall lies to the south, east is the
armorer, and the central corridor is to the west.  {x

description: {gPart of the open quadrangle surrounding the central keep, This open

gatehouse.  {x

40228.name: Administrative Offices
description: {yBookshelves{8 line the stone walls of this small and cramped room.
Single arrow slits in the south and west walls bring in the only
natural light to this room, attesting to the military nature of the
structure.  The room is dominated by an immense {yma{rho{Rg{ran{yy d{res{yk{8 that is
piled high with papers.  The "in" box is overflowing with documents,
and a small pile of parchments are in the "out" box.  A small coal
fireplace stands in the corner providing warmth to the room.  The
keep's central corridor is to the east.  {x

40292.name: The Back Room of the Store
description: {8This room is lined with work stations with alchemical supplies
as well as brewing vats for alcohol.  Friar Tuck's Journeyman
wanders back and forth between stations checking temperatures
and mixing concoctions.  The center of the room is dominated
by a large set of shelves holding many ingredients for various
potions.{x

40220.name: Southwestern Parapet
description: {cThe walls of the keep are high, rising more than 50 feet to their
tops.  Stairs lead up from the courtyard below, allowing the guards
who stand duty to access these crenelated walls.  Having a dual
purpose, these battlements allow defenders a clear view both without
and within, completely surrounding the courtyard and allowing
individuals to quickly move between locations while remaining unseen
to those below.
{x

40236.name: Dining Hall of the Order
description: {8The Dining Hall of the Order is an immense room with giant
fireplaces set in the east and west walls.  Long tables with benches
worn smoothy by years of use flank a central walkway leading into the
main hall.  The smells of roasting food come from the back where the
kitchn workers are constantly working to keep food ready for returning
soldiers of the Order.  Myrtle, the Matron of the Hall, wanders from
table to table ensuring everything meets her tough standards.  {x

40254.name: Northeast Corridor
description: {8A smaller and generally quiet corridor, the ceilings here peak in
Gothic Arches a paltry twelve feet tall.  Unlike the traffic of the
Main Hall, these small side corridors lead to the private rooms of
various members of the Order.  Small pieces of artwork fill alcoves
near each room, dictated by the whims of the various occupants.  {x

no windows in the cell and no furnishings other than a pile of
dirty straw in one corner.  A faint smell of human waste comes
from a bucket in the far corner.{x

40208.name: Western Courtyard
description: {g The western courtyard is lined with a {8cobbled path {g running due
east and west.  This path is flanked by green grassy spaces to the
north and south as the courtyard spreads to the corners of the
defensive walls.  To the west lies the {BG{bat{me {8of the {BS{bet{mti{Mng {BS{bu{8n{g, the
west entrance to the Stronghold of the Order.  The courtyard continues
to the north, south, and east.  {x

40265.name: Clan Member Room

{corder.{x

40286.name: A Cobblestone Road
description: The cobblestone road is flanked by a sparse covering of trees to
the north and south.  The road feels open and exposed, but the trees
offer no better cover.  The road continues to the east and the west.

40241.name: Council Chambers of the Order
description: {8The Council Chambers of the Order are a large round room, similar
to the Antechamber, but on a much larger scale.  The {CC{cr{Yy{ys{wt{ya{cl {CD{co{Ym{Ce{8 over
this chamber is likewise larger in scale.  Etched into the crystal are
the Right Handed War Gauntlet of Helm, and the Left Handed War
Gauntlet of Torm.  The walls are adorned with the War Banners of
vanquished foes, and the center of the room is dominated by a
triangular shaped table, allowing for the Prelates to sit on one side,
Chancellors on another, and the third side being seating for the
remainder of the members of the Order.  An archway to the east enters
a room containing artifacts of the Great Realms, while an archway to
the west enters a room with artifacts of Faerun.  North, beyond the
council chambers lies the {RH{reart {8of the {RO{rrder.  {x

40238.name: Center Main Hall
description: {8The Main Hall continues north and south from this location.  This
hall is the main traffic route through the second floor of the keep.
Pages and squires of the order are oft seen running errands along the
halls, and visitors stand an admire the tapestries depicting the
Order's History.  {x

40239.name: South Main Hall
description: {8The southern portion of the Main Hall is the terminus of the hall
on this floor.  A set of spiral stairs leads up to the third floor of
the keep, and side corridors branch both east and west leading to the
private rooms of members of the Order.  Suits of highly polished armor
flank the sides of the spiral stair, giving it a sense of formality
that is lacking in other portions of the keep.  {x

{R[FOR RENT]{x

40213.name: Order Paddocks
description: The paddocks are large open fields where mounts of the Order roam
when not in use.  Unlike regular paddocks, here there are groves of
trees interspersed with open fields allowing some of the more special
mounts to have places to roost or hide from prying eyes.

description: {cThe battlements between the corner stairs provide excellent shelter

40283.name: Road before the Gate of the Setting Sun
description: The cobblestone road is ends here at the Gate of the Setting Sun.
The gate is set in immense stone walls, stretching more than forty
feet into the air, and heading north and south from the gate for some
distance.  The trees have been cleared back from this location ,
providing good view and open shots for archers on the walls.  The
cobblestone road continues to the west.

40281.name: Connor's Petshop
description: {8Connor's Petshop sells only one type of pet, the ferocious timber
wolves from the Dragonspine Mountains.  Capturing one in the wild is
difficult enough, but Connor has managed to capture several and
maintain a captive breeding program for these immense Wolves.  The
Petshop is large, owing to the size of the animals.{x

40251.name: Gate of the Rising Sun
description: {8The {YG{yat{Ye {wof {rt{Rh{me {MRi{rsi{Rng{y S{wu{Yn,{8 facing due east, this stout gate is the
main access to the keep from the outside world.  Each morning members
of the order stand in formation facing the {YG{ya{Yt{ye{8 as it is opened at
sunrise before dispersing to their individual duties.  This morning
ritual is the start of all members' days and symbolizes the light they
bring to the world by standing against the darkness.  This gate
remains open throughout the day, only closing down at sunset in
preparation of opening the {BG{ba{mte {8of the {BS{be{mtt{bin{8g {BS{bu{8n.  {x

40201.name: Hell's Maw
description: {8Called {RH{rell's {RM{raw {8by those who have attacked the Stronghold, this
room is the first treat for potential invaders.  {yIron Spikes{8 are set
in the walls to catch the unwary, or distract any attackers, while the
thick stone walls are pierced by murder holes and arrow slits to rain
down death to the enemies of the Order.  {x

40290.name: A Cobblestone Road
description: The cobblestone road heads east, linking with the Eastern Highway
to the south.  Scattered trees flank the road, providing some welcome

40249.name: Entrance to the Bolt Hole
description: {8A rough hewn passageway, cut through the very bones of the earth.
Chisel marks can be seen in the stone, and the low, rough ceiling
threatens each skull that passes beneath.  The room has an oppressive
feeling to it, almost as if the earth were closing in on those who
walk this way.  The air is dank and musty, with a small channel of
{cwater {8running down the center.  The passage continues to the north and
south.  {x

40215.name: Central Courtyard
description: {gThe central courtyard is located at the junction of the two {8cobbled
paths{g forming an x in the center.  At this juncture, a large square
building rises up from the courtyard, forming the center of the
Stronghold of the Order of the Radiant Heart.  A large set of {8stone
stairs{g leads up here to a massive wood and iron door.  {x

40270.name: Clan Member Room
description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and a small pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the Order
chosing to live within the hall may expect.  All other creature
comforts and personal designs are to be provided by members of the
Order.  Members desireing to occupy rooms within the halls of the
Order are expected to pay a tithe to the Order, amounting to 100
platinum per month.
{R[FOR RENT]{x

40212.name: Stables of the Order
description: {YT{yhe stables of the Order house mounts both mundane and fantastical
for the Order's members.  Everything from the common horse to the
not-so-common dragon have stalls and rooms set aside for them here.
The stables are built into the very walls of the keep, adding strength
both through their barrel vaulted construction and through the
honeycomb structure of their halls.  {x

40258.name: Southeast Corridor
description: {8A smaller and generally quiet corridor, the ceilings here peak in
Gothic Arches a paltry twelve feet tall.  Unlike the traffic of the
Main Hall, these small side corridors lead to the private rooms of
various members of the Order.  Small pieces of artwork fill alcoves
near each room, dictated by the whims of the various occupants.  {x

40297.name: Sparring Grounds
description: {8This is a sand floored room with a domed ceiling help up by large
pillars throughout the chamber.  Weapon racks line the walls offering
a large selection of tools to practice with.  Blood marks some of
the pillars from sparring sessions turned too serious.{x

40227.name: North Central Corridor
description: {8The northern terminus of the central corridor, with the entrance to
the Stonghold far to the south.  North is the temple store, west is
Torm's Chapel, and East is Helm's Chapel.  A set of spiral stair leads
both up and down from this location.  Up is the Order's Dining Hall,
and Down lay the dungeons.  {x

40276.name: Clan Member Room
description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and a small pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the Order
chosing to live within the hall may expect.  All other creature
comforts and personal designs are to be provided by members of the
Order.  Members desireing to occupy rooms within the halls of the
Order are expected to pay a tithe to the Order, amounting to 100
platinum per month.
{R[FOR RENT]{x

40306.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8This is a small cramped cell with cold stone walls.  Several
spots on the wall are marked by previous prisoners.  There are
no windows in the cell and no furnishings other than a pile of
dirty straw in one corner.  A faint smell of human waste comes
from a bucket in the far corner.{x

40264.name: Gate of the Setting Sun
description: {8The {BG{ba{mte {8of the {BS{be{mtt{bin{8g {BS{bu{8n faces due west.  This gate is only
opened at sunset, with members of the order formed up in defensive
lines, weapons at the ready.  To members of the Order, this formation
reminds them to be vigilant in the darkness, to look out for the
defenseless, and to stand as a shield against the horrors of the
darkness.  This gate remains open at night, and heavily guarded until
it is time for the changing of the watch and the opening of the {YG{yat{Ye
{wof {rt{Rh{me {MRi{rsi{Rng {yS{wu{Yn{8 with the coming of the {YD{yaw{Yn.  {x

40231.name: Practice Hall
description: {8The practice hall is a large room with high ceilings supported by
massive stone columns.  It is here that members of the Order come to
practice their skills under the expert tutelage of the Order's {RM{ra{yst{re{Rr
{yof {RB{ra{ytt{rl{Re{8.  {x {8The central corridor is to the west, and to the north is
Helm's Chapel.  {x

40370.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40222.name: Northwestern Parapet
description: {cThe walls of the keep are high, rising more than 50 feet to their
tops.  Stairs lead up from the courtyard below, allowing the guards
who stand duty to access these crenelated walls.  Having a dual
purpose, these battlements allow defenders a clear view both without
and within, completely surrounding the courtyard and allowing
individuals to quickly move between locations while remaining unseen
to those below.  {x

40268.name: Clan Member Room
description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and a small pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the Order
chosing to live within the hall may expect.  All other creature
comforts and personal designs are to be provided by members of the
{corder.

40288.name: A Cobblestone Road
description: The road continues north and south from this location.  Trees flank
the sides of of the road, but they are relatively few in number,
providing a good view of the countryside.  The Eastern Highway lies
somewhere to the south.

40310.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40200.name: Portcullis of the Outer Gate
description: {8The Portcullis of the Outer Gate is an imposing strucutre.
Designed to protect the Keep from attack, this heavy iron grate stands
a massive twelve feet tall and ten feet wide, easily allowing a horse
and rider through when it is open.  The Portcullis is set in an
incredibly thick stone wall, the outer face of the Gatehouse to the
Stronghold of the Order of the Radiant Heart.  Through the four-inch
thick iron bars a dark corridor can be seen to the north, winding into
the depths of the Gatehouse.  {x

40233.name: Helm's Armorer
description: {8This forge is manned by the Priests of Helm, and is where they toil
to create armor for the Order.  A large stone fireplace with an
extended basin allows two or three priests to work at a time.
Impressive {yleather bellows{8 hang from the ceiling, and are attached to
the forge, allowing the smiths to adjust the temperature as needed.
Three anvils are spread around the fire at cardinal points allowing
easy access to the fire and enough room to work.  Quenching troughs
filled with various liquids are near each station.  Racks of partially
finished armor line the north wall, while tongs and hammers of the
trade hang on the south.  {x

description: {8The Gate of Shadows, this entrance into the Stronghold of the Order
is a secret known only to the members of the Order.  To the north lies
a rough hewn passage, cut from the very stones of the earth.  {cWater
{8runs down the center of the passage, cutting a small channel through
the stone.  {x

40221.name: Western Parapet
description: {cThe battlements between the corner stairs provide excellent shelter
from the view of prying eyes, while allowing individuals to keep a
good lookout on what is going on around them.  Fifty feet above the
courtyard below, these walls are used by guards to make routine rounds
and ensure the integrity of the Stronghold of the Order.  Below is the
Gate of the Setting Sun.  {x

40218.name: Southeastern Parapet
description: {cThe walls of the keep are high, rising more than 50 feet to their
tops.  Stairs lead up from the courtyard below, allowing the guards
who stand duty to access these crenelated walls.  Having a dual
purpose, these battlements allow defenders a clear view both without
and within, completely surrounding the courtyard and allowing
individuals to quickly move between locations while remaining unseen
to those below.  {x

40209.name: Northwestern Courtyard
description: {gThe Northwestern corner of the Courtyard is a grass covered expanse
used by archers for target practice.  Archery butts are set against
the west wall, and range markers are placed at ten yard intervals for
accurate range calibration.  A {8set of stone stairs{g leads up to the
parapets above, providing guards easy access to their posts for doing
rounds while on duty.  The courtyard spreads out south and east from
here.  {x

40299.name: Sparring Grounds
description: {8This is a sand floored room with a domed ceiling help up by large
pillars throughout the chamber.  Weapon racks line the walls offering
a large selection of tools to practice with.  Blood marks some of
the pillars from sparring sessions turned too serious.{x

40291.name: The Dungeon of the Black Heart
description: {DDeep within the compound of the {RR{rad{yi{rant {RH{re{ya{rr{Rt{D, lies the Dungeon of
the {WBlack Heart{D.  This chamber is made from old brick and stone that
was left over from the construction of the Great Hall.  Although it
seems weathered with time, the stone and brick can't even be scratched
by the sharpest of swords, or the strongest of spells.  The only other
item of note in this chamber, is a {Yg{yo{Wld{ye{Yn{D rope, tied into a noose at
one end that magically seems to float up and down without any effort.
This chamber is researved for the most severe crime against the {RR{rad{yi{rant
{RH{re{ya{rr{Rt{D...{WTreason{D.{x

40263.name: Hell's Maw Guardroom
description: {8For a guard room, this is a fairly large room, two fireplaces with
hobs for a guard room, this is a fairly large room, two fireplaces
with hobs for the heating of oil are on opposite sides of the room.
Casks of oil, crossbows, and quarrels fill shelves scattered around
the room.  In the center of the room is a small table with several
stools.  Guards in this room can quickly deploy into {RHell's Maw {8to
repel attackers.  {x

40211.name: Northeastern Courtyard
description: {gThe Northeastern corner of the Courtyard is a grass covered expanse
used by those of the arcane pursuasions to practice the more lethal
arts in their repertoire.  Black scorch marks pock the grass, and
large craters can be seen in some places.  A {8set of stone stairs{g leads
up to the parapets above, providing guards easy access to their posts
for doing rounds while on duty.  The courtyard spreads out south and
{gwest from here.{x

40287.name: A Coblestone Road
description: The road curves from the south to the east here.  Far to the east
there appears to be a large stone structure, while to the south, the
hills roll towards the town of Irieabor.  The trees in this area are
few in number, but the ones that are present are ancient, with thick
trunks and wide branches.

40229.name: Lounge of the Order
description: {8The lounge of the Order is a confortable room.  An immense {Yf{ri{Rr{Ye
{8place dominates the eastern wall and is flanked by arrow slits.  An
additional arrow slit is in the southern wall, flanked by tapestries
of epic battles from the history of the Order.  Plush carpets cover
the stone floor adding to the warmth of the room.  The central
corridor lies to the west.  {x

40327.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

40274.name: Clan Member Room
description: {cA small room with a writing desk, an armchair, and a small pallet
along the wall.  These are the small comforts members of the Order
chosing to live within the hall may expect.  All other creature
comforts and personal designs are to be provided by members of the
Order.  Members desireing to occupy rooms within the halls of the
Order are expected to pay a tithe to the Order, amounting to 100
platinum per month.
{R[FOR RENT]{x

40226.name: Central Corridor
description: {8The central corridor runs north and south through the center of the
keep.  The corridor forms the main artery for traffic through the
keep.  West are the Baths of the Order, and to the east is the
Practice Hall where the members are free to practice martial and
magical skills.  The central corridor continues to the north and
south.  {x

40244.name: Heart of the Order
description: {8This room is known as the {RH{reart {8of the {RO{rrder{8 and is sacred to
members of the order.  It is here that members come for solitude, and
to seek inner peace and understanding.  A small altar stands along the
northern wall, draped in a {YY{yellow {YA{yltar {YC{yloth.  {8 Above this altar
{8stands a pair of pennants with the symbol of the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr {8of the {RR{ra{Yd{yi{Ya{rn{Rt
H{re{Ya{rr{Rt{8, emblazoned upon them.

40298.name: Sparring Grounds
description: {8This is a sand floored room with a domed ceiling help up by large
pillars throughout the chamber.  Weapon racks line the walls offering
a large selection of tools to practice with.  Blood marks some of
the pillars from sparring sessions turned too serious.{x

40358.name: {8The Dungeon of the {RR{rad{yi{ran{Rt H{re{ya{rr{Rt{x
description: {8The stone block hallways glisten with dampness seeping in from the
ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making
navigation difficult.{x

ground.  faint noises can be heard through the stone in all directions.
The lights flicker in the distance giving only the briefest respite
from the darkness.  All around are large iron bound doors making

40201.name: {CC{coyle{8, {CP{criest {8of {RT{ror{Rm {8and {CM{caster {CW{ceaponsmith{x~
description:
Coyle is one of the High Priests of Torm, assigned to duty in the
Stronghold of the Order of the Radiant Heart.  His primary duty is
overseeing the construction of weapons for the Order and ensuring each
and every one has Torm's Blessing.  As the master weaponsmith, he
oversees a group of younger priests developing their skills.

40202.name: {CD{carius{8, {CP{criest {8of {BH{belm {8and {CM{caster {CA{crmorsmith{x~
description:
Darius is one of the High Priests of Helm, assigned to duty in the
Stronghold of the Order of the Radiant Heart.  His primary duty is
overseeing the construction of armor for the Order and ensuring each
and every one has Helm's Blessing.  As the master armorsmith, he
oversees a group of younger priests developing their skills.

40203.name: {RA{rn {RE{rnch{ya{ynted {RP{rrac{ytice {RD{rum{ymy{x~
description:
The practice dummy of the Order's Hall has been enchanted with some
powerful magics in order to give it the feeling of a more lifelike
opponent.  Members of the Order are encouraged to come and practice
their skills under the tutelage of the Order's Weaponsmaster, Sevano.
40203.room_name: {RA{rn {RE{rnch{ya{ynted {RP{rrac{ytice {RD{rum{ymy{8 is propped up on a stand.{x

40204.name: {CC{corwin{8, the {CC{captain {yof the {CG{cuard{x~
description:
Corwin has been Captain of the Guard for as long as most can
remember.  His white hair and numerous battle scars attest to his
competence in battle.  He wears a suit of immaculate plate armor and
carries a bastard sword.
subroutines:
M exall 40239 0~
M death 40217 100~
40204.room_name: {CC{corwin{8, the {CC{captain {yof the {CG{cuard{x defends the inner gate.

40205.name: {RS{revano{y, {wA{8rmsmaster {cof the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr{x~
description:
Sevano appears to be a middle-aged gentleman, with long salt and
pepper hair tied back to keep it out of his face while he works.  His
long thing face and aqueline nose give him the appearance of some bird
or prey, especially when coupled with his piercing steel grey eyes. 
After numerous campaigns, and more than a few battle scars, he has
retired to become the Armsmaster of the Order, teaching the next
generation of troops the ways of battle.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
40205.room_name: {RS{revano{y,{c the {wA{8rmsmaster {cof the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr{x stands ready to teach.

40206.name: {RM{ryrtle{Y, {8the {RD{rining {YH{yall {RC{rhef{x~
description:
Myrtle is not what one would call an attractive woman, portly with
a bad complexion, the hair net just sets everything off and brings
back memories of institutional food.  Luckily for the members of the
Order, the appearance is where the similarities end, for Myrtle is a
truly outstanding cook, and serves up some of the most savory fare in
the realms.
subroutines:
M grall 40202 100~
M speech 40203 room please~
40206.room_name: {RM{ryrtle{Y, {8the {RD{rining {YH{yall {RC{rhef{x stands ready to serve her latest concoction.

40207.name: {RJ{reeves{8, the {BB{cath {BA{cttendant{x~
description:
Jeeves is a rail thin man.  He has tended the baths for as long as
any can remember, and over the years of being in close proximity to
the priests of both Helm and Torm, has picked up quite a bit about the
healing arts...  Nothing like a good soak for the bones to aid in
healing.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
40207.room_name: {RJ{reeves{8, the {BB{cath {BA{cttendant {8is here to to attend to your needs.{x

40208.name: {RA F{ya{rll{ye{Rn A{yn{rg{ye{Rl{x~
description:
This Fallen Angel, cast out of the heavens as punishment for some
unknown crime, is serving its pennance as a guard for the Order of the
Radiant Heart.  Should it serve well for a hundred years, perhaps it
will be allowed to return to the heavens.

40209.name: {RB{rrannon {xthe {RS{rtable {RM{raster{x~
description:
Brannon is a young man by all appearances, with brown hair, green
eyes and a ready smile.  While not overly handsome, he has a pleasant
demeanor.  Despite his apparent youth, he has proven himself adept at
animal husbandry, managing even the most difficult of animal care
tasks with ease.  More importanly, he is trusted by the Dragons.  {x

40211.name: {CC{co{mnn{cor {8the {RT{rim{yb{rer {RW{rol{Rf {RB{rre{ye{rde{Rr{x~
description:
Connor is a thin man, all the more impressive for the fact that he
has managed to tame the ferocious timber wolves of the Dragonspine
Mountains.  He manages the petshop in the Hall of the Order, believing
these noble beasts best serve the cause of good.

40212.name: {RF{rriar {RT{ruck{y, {YB{yrewmaster {8of the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr{x~
description:
Friar Tuck is well known for his brewing, both of potions and of
other fine libations.  Fond of drink of all kind, this jolly man
stands just over five and a half feet tall, and is a portly fellow to
boot.  Bald and jolly, he is the finest brewmaster the Order has ever
seen.
40212.t_flags: T {Y*{RHIC{Y* {8Can I shelp you with anyshing {Y*{Rhic{Y*{x~
40212.room_name: {RF{rriar {RT{ruck{y, {YB{yrewmaster {8of the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr {8of the {RR{ra{Yd{Ri{Ya{rn{Rt H{re{Ya{rr{Rt{8 stands here ready to serve.

40213.name: {RG{reoff{y, {8the {gGaoler{x~
description:
Geoff, the Gaoler, pines for the old days when he actually had a
job to do...  Now he stands around in the dungeon and beats people
over the head when they need it...  For which there is some
satisfaction...
subroutines: F for A
40213.room_name: {RG{reoff{y, {8the {gGaoler{x is here smiling with is two-tooth smile.

40214.name: {YA{ymber{8, {RS{recretary {8of the {RO{rr{Yd{re{Rr{8.{x~
description:
Amber has been with the Order for so long, few remember a time when
she wasn't there.  She takes care of the daily administration for the
Order, including requisitioning supplies and keeping the logs for the
members.
40214.t_flags: T Good Day, is there something you need?  I am quite busy, so unless it's important, don't bother me.~

40218.name: {BC{bh{8a{bd{Be{x~
description:
Chade is the Spymaster of the Order of the Radiant Heart.  He is
often merely referred to as "Dark Blade" because his past is shadowed,
and it is rumored he was once one of the most feared assassins in the
realms.

description:
This is a boy in his mid teenage years, skinny unlike his
teacher.  He moves between the tables in the room engrossed
in attempting to master the complex recipes of all of the
potions that Friar Tuck offers to the order.{x

40220.name: {RF{rriar {RT{ruck's {CA{cpprentice{x~
description:
This is a small boy no older than ten years old.  He wears
the same sort of robes as his master only unadorned.  He moves
between racks of supplies taking count of what is needed to
restock supplies.
